Children's books

    Written by Jo Dixon on Oct 1, 2015

    Curl up this autumn with one of our top new books, with topics covering beasts and bears to bobble hats.

  • Starting playgroup and school in 2015

    Written by Jo Dixon on Sep 3, 2015

    Picture books and junior novels for starting or returning to playgroup and school.

  • New children’s books for September 2015

    Written by Jo Dixon on Sep 1, 2015

    Books, eBooks and eAudiobooks for children and teens, including new titles from Terry Pratchett and Louis Sachar.

  • YA fiction at Edinburgh International Book Festival 2015

    Written by Emma Raindle on Aug 4, 2015

    Edinburgh International Book Festival is the largest bookfest in the world, running 15-31 August 2015. Here are a selection of YA authors appearing at the festival.

  • New children’s books for August 2015

    Written by Jo Dixon on Jul 31, 2015

    Brand new selection of board books, picture books, junior and YA books.

  • New children’s books for July 2015

    Written by Jo Dixon on Jul 1, 2015

    From dodgy hamburgers to adventures at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, there are plenty of choices for children and teenagers.

  • New children’s books for June 2015

    Written by Jo Dixon on Jun 1, 2015

    This month offers a range of books about troublesome toddler gorillas to successful vloggers.

  • New children’s books for May 2015

    Written by Jo Dixon on May 1, 2015

    All the best new books for young children, older children and teenagers.

  • New children’s books for April 2015

    Written by Jo Dixon on Apr 1, 2015

    New children's books, from picture books up to younger teens.

  • New children’s books for March 2015

    Written by Jo Dixon on Feb 24, 2015

    New books, eBooks and eAudiobooks with authors such as Julia Jarman, Rebecca Ashdown and James Campbell.

  • Year of the Goat in 2015

    Written by Jo Dixon on Feb 13, 2015

    Goat-themed books to celebrate the Chinese new year.

  • Diaries and Journals for 2015

    Written by Jo Dixon on Jan 9, 2015

    Recommended literary diaries and journals for older children and teens.

  • New children’s books for January 2015

    Written by Jo Dixon on Dec 30, 2014

    Including titles from Russell Brand, B. J. Novak and Zoe Sugg.

  • New children’s books for November 2014

    Written by Jo Dixon on Nov 1, 2014

    November's new additions bring not only crime thrillers to rival Guy Fawkes' story in the form of Harlan Coben's new teen novel Found, but also a generous amount of heart-warming picture books like Sam & Dave Dig a Hole and trivia to stir up laughs such as The Beano Joke Book.

  • New children’s books for October 2014

    Written by Jo Dixon on Oct 2, 2014

    Including an alien abduction, This Book Just Ate my Dog and a thriller at the Burghley horse trials.

  • New children’s books for September 2014

    Written by Jo Dixon on Aug 21, 2014

    Including Dutch classic The cat who came in off the roof, an Antoine de Saint–Exupery biography and a picture book about Enormouse, who returns to the welcome companionship of his friends, the mice.

  • New children’s books for August 2014

    Written by Jo Dixon on Jul 31, 2014

    Books to reserve and download, including a Michael Morpurgo Great War anthology, a new Julia Donaldson and Axel Scheffler picturebook about a scarecrow wedding and a choose your own adventure. Perfect for the Summer Reading Challenge.

  • Mythical Maze for Summer Reading Challenge 2014

    Written by Jo Dixon on Jul 18, 2014

    Myth and monster books to keep your children reading over the summer. Ideal for the Summer Reading Challenge.

  • New children’s books for July 2014

    Written by Jo Dixon on Jun 30, 2014

    Including a beautifully designed book about a project to build a car in wartime France that will appeal to older children and 2CV fans, a stylish picture book tour around London that follows the queen's hat and Ed Vere's latest, Max the Brave.

  • New children’s books for June 2014

    Written by Jo Dixon on May 29, 2014

    Including a picture book starring a dog in a garage, a pacy series of 4 books set in wartime Norfolk and an astonishing story of a 15 year old's struggle to come to terms with her mum's death.

  • New children’s books for May 2014

    Written by Jo Dixon on Apr 28, 2014

    Fantastic new titles, including picture books, teen reads and short chapter books.

  • New children’s books for March 2014

    Written by Jo Dixon on Mar 4, 2014

    Including an hilarious book about a frog who hates phonics, a rerelease of 90's classic How to Eat Fried Worms and a new teen detective novel Running Girl, by Simon Mason.

  • New children’s books for February 2014

    Written by Jo Dixon on Feb 5, 2014

    Including titles from Michael Rosen, a new Wimpy Kid book and a story about baby aliens getting to a horrible teacher.

  • New children’s books for January 2014

    Written by Jo Dixon on Jan 27, 2014

    Including titles from Michael Rosen and Malorie Blackman and a story about a dog who leaves his mean minded family to seek his fortune on the stage.
